article.headline: Hartford 76, Monmouth 75
article.story: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J. (AP) -- Jaret Von Rosenberg hit four free throws in the final seconds to give Hartford a 76-75 win over Monmouth on Saturday night. Bo Taylor had 21 points to lead Hartford (4-4), while Michael Turner added 18 points and eight rebounds. Dejan Delic made 7-of-10 from 3-point range and scored a game-high 24 points for Monmouth (3-8), while Whitney Coleman finished with 19 points and Jhamar Youngblood added 12. The teams traded baskets for most of the game, which featured 11 lead changes, but Hartford took the lead for good when Taylor made a conventional three-point play with 53.5 seconds left to give Hartford a 70-67 lead. Delic's tip-in with 40.5 seconds left narrowed the lead to 70-69, but Hartford then hit six free throws down the stretch, the last two by Von Rosenberg with 2.2 seconds left. Delic then hit a 3-pointer at the buzzer for the game's final points. Monmouth won the battle of the boards, outrebounding Hartford 27-22, but hurt itself by missing some key shots and free throws in the game's closing minutes.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
